page.title: 04PIG FARMING AT WHITEWOOL FM.
page.content: We are engaged in an "intensive" system where the animals are housed for the whole of their life.Sows are housed in a large building with moderate temperature and served by boars housed seperately in the same house.Farrowing takes place in another building consisting of several rooms,each containing 12 crates.Births can be synchronised by the use of drugs and we aim for more than 10 pigs per litter.Weaning is at 17 days when the piglets are transferred into a smaller house which has a very accurate controlled environment.After four weeks they are moved into further accomodation and are feed on a liquid diet until sale at 80 kilos live weight.
